text:
Food Safe Wipes | D2 Disinfectant Wipes
Alpet D2 Surface Sanitizing Wipes
Alpet D2 Surface Sanitizing Wipes are a ready-to-use, no-rinse, lintless wiping system for food contact surfaces. They are available in a 90-count heavy duty wipe canister and a 160-count medium duty wipe canister. As with all Best Sanitizers wiping systems, the spring-loaded lid closes on its own to prevent the drying of wipes, helping to eliminate unnecessary waste.
Clean and sanitize with one product
Sanitizes food contact and non-food contact surfaces
Kills 99.999% of Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica (formerly typhimurium) and Listeria monocytogenes as a food contact surface sanitizer
Kills 99.9% of tested pathogens in 10 seconds as a non-food contact surface sanitizer
58% IPA/quat formula ideal for water sensitive equipment
Strong, lintless wipes for food contact surfaces
Spring-loaded lid to prevent drying
Ready-to-use, no-rinse required
NSF listed D2 classification
Kosher, Pareve and Halal certified
What Makes D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes Food Safe?
The main difference between regular disinfectant wipes and D2 Sanitizers surface sanitizing wipes are the ingredients. D2 wipes have alcohol or other risk-free agents that can be used when cleaning food areas, which kill 99.999% of germs such as Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica (formerly typhimurium) and Listeria monocytogenes. 
When choosing surface sanitizing food safe wipes, it's important to check for approvals from trusted groups like the NSF (National Sanitation Foundation). NSF listed products meet rigorous safety and efficacy standards, ensuring they are suitable for use in environments where food or high sanitation cleaning is critical. 
The Benefits of Using D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes in the Kitchen
Using D2 Sanitizing surface sanitizing wipes in your kitchen is a great way to keep things clean and make your cleaning easier. These wipes are a ready-to-use, no-rinse and lintless wiping system for food contact surfaces. This helps you keep your food protected, so you can feel good knowing your kitchen is clean.
Surface sanitizing wipes also make cleaning simpler. You don’t need to use sprays or different cleaning products. Just grab a wipe, clean the surface, and throw it away. It's really that simple! 
Also, with all D2 Sanitizers wipes, the spring-loaded lid closes on its own to prevent the drying of wipes, helping to eliminate unnecessary waste.
Enhancing Food Safety Protocols with D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes
Food safety should come first in every kitchen. Using D2 Sanitizing surface sanitizing wipes in your daily cleaning can help a lot. Wiping down surfaces where food touches before and after use can keep harmful bacteria at bay. This way, you lower the chance of germs and food illnesses.
Food service places, like restaurants and cafes, can also gain from using D2 Sanitizers surface sanitizing wipes. These businesses need to follow strict health rules. By using the right sanitizing wipes, especially those that are NSF listed, they can meet health standards while keeping a protected place for customers.
Whether you cook at home or work as a chef, using surface sanitizing disinfectant wipes shows you care about a clean kitchen. This care for food safety protects your health and builds trust with people who enjoy what you cook.
D2 Sanitizers Quick and Efficient Surface Sanitizing Wipes
Time is valuable, especially in a busy kitchen. D2 wipes offer a quick way to cleaning workspaces without losing effectiveness. These wipes are soaked with the right amount of cleaning agents, so you don’t have to measure or mix anything.
Some of the main benefits of using surface sanitizing wipes for cleaning surfaces in the kitchen:
Saves Time: Just grab a wipe, clean the surface, and throw it away. There is no need to rinse or dry.
Easy to Use: Many food sanitizing wipes come in small packages. This makes them simple to store in drawers or keep nearby for fast cleanups.
Flexible: You can use these wipes on many types of food contact surfaces, such as counters, cutting boards, sinks, and appliances.
Keeping food contact surfaces protected in your kitchen is very important. Choosing the right sanitizing wipe can greatly improve how you ensure food safety. These wipes allow for quick and easy cleaning of surfaces. By using good quality wipes meant for food contact surfaces, you can keep your kitchen clean and secure. 
Sanitizing Wipes FAQs
Do I need to wear gloves when applying this product to surfaces?
This product does not require gloves to be worn when sanitizing high touch, hard surfaces. If you have sensitive skin, you may want to consider wearing gloves simply as a precaution.
What is Alpet D2 used for?
Alpet D2 is an effective disinfectant that kills viruses like norovirus on hard, food and non-food contact surfaces. The purpose of an Alpet D2 formula spray or wipe is to eliminate tested pathogens, keep your facility clean and protect consumers from sickness.
What is the difference between disinfecting and sanitizing wipes?
Sanitization removes bacterial particles using chemical substances and fights against viruses. Alpet D2 is an EPA-approved product with powerful efficacy and response time for eliminating strep, norovirus and listeria. Disinfecting with chemicals means it will completely eliminate contaminants from surfaces.
What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?
Contact to sensitive parts of the body may result in a stinging feeling or slight irritation. This irritation is treatable. If contact has been made with the eyes, gently rinse eyes with water as soon as possible. It may take 15 to 20 minutes to recover. If inhaled or swallowed, get some fresh air and breathe slowly.
If conditions still persist, call your doctor for medical attention.
Does Alpet D2 kill 99.9% of viruses and bacteria including cold flu?
Yes, D2 wipes quickly sanitize 99.9% of tested pathogens in 10 seconds. Active ingredients work together on equipment and other surfaces for fast disinfection, leaving a positive and lasting impression. Within 60 seconds, the disinfectant will have a higher chance to eliminate more bacteria including cold, flu and strep—up to 99.999%.
Where is Alpet No-Rinse Quat Sanitizer frequently used?
Alpet No-Rinse Quat Sanitizer is one of the most versatile chemicals, as it is used to disinfect in government buildings, hospital applications, restaurants and open air market applications. It can be made into an easy spray and into a disinfectant wipe for walls and tables.
Quats are ammonium salts that have a positively-charged nitrogen atom at their center. This basic molecule can be modified in many different ways to create quat-based compounds, which are then used as sanitizers and disinfectants. (Note: Quats have NO ODOR. Ammonium is not ammonia.)
What is the difference between Smart-San cleaning wipes and Alpet D2 surface sanitizing wipes?
The main distinction between these wipes is the purpose of application and design for consumers. Alpet D2 is a highly powerful disinfectant for food contact surfaces and food manufacturing facilities. However, Smart-San is a sanitizer for personal cleaning to kill germs on the body and other surfaces.
Is a sanitizing spray bottle or wipe better for cleaning?
Wipes are more powerful than spraying and using a cloth. When using a cloth and spray, you can create uneven coverage and reduce the effectiveness of the cleaner. Wipes are the most reliable option for cleaning high-infection areas and eliminating more bacteria on surfaces.
Where can I use Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes?
Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes work well for households, office spaces and public buildings. While manufacturers may purchase the wipes, this product is not designed to kill bacteria on food contact surfaces. Smart-San wipes are a best seller for cleaning bathrooms, glass, walls and more.
Are there harsh chemicals in Smart-San All-Purpose wipes?
No, Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes contain two main active ingredients: ethanol and isopropyl. Neither component is tough on skin or harmful to users.
What is the benzalkonium chloride (BAC) formula?
Benzalkonium chloride (BAC) is an active ingredient in household cleaners, hand sanitizers and many liquid soaps, including disinfectant soaps. As an antimicrobial agent, the BAC formula disrupts the functionality of many pathogens such as bacteria, viruses and fungi. Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.
Is peracetic acid safe for use on all food contact surfaces?
Peracetic acid is safe for many food contact surfaces since it breaks down into harmless substances. However, it’s important to think about how you use it. You need to consider the type of surface, how long it stays in contact, the pH value and any organic matter. These factors can affect how well it works and its safety.
How often should surfaces be sanitized in a food processing area?
Surfaces in food processing areas can get contaminated by bacteria like Salmonella and norovirus, so it is important to clean and sanitize them often with a foodservice surface sanitizer spray. Sanitize whenever there is a chance of contamination and at least every four hours. Use the right amount, which is usually a few fluid ounces per gallon of water, and rinse if needed. The cleaning frequency may change based on the product you use and how you apply it.
Can D2 Sanitizers products be used on all types of food contact surface?
D2 Sanitizers products are very versatile. The surface sanitizer spray is highly effective, quickly cleaning and disinfecting a variety of food contact surface. Our products work well on many hard and soft surfaces. However, always look at the product label to see if it is safe for a specific surface. If you are unsure, you can try a quick test on a hidden spot to check if the material is safe.
Are D2 Sanitizers products safe for use around food and customers?
D2 Sanitizers focuses on keeping food safe. Our products follow strict industry rules and are safe to use on food contact surfaces, as long as you use them correctly. They are also highly effective in eliminating human coronavirus quickly and efficiently on food-contact surfaces, ensuring a safe dining environment. There are precautionary statements on the packaging to help guide you, just like with hand soaps or cleaners. 
What are the benefits of using a D2 Sanitizers footwear sanitizing system in food service?
Sanitizing systems play a vital role in maintaining cleanliness and safety in food service environments. By reducing the risk of cross-contamination, these systems enhance food safety, protect public health and contribute to a better customer experience.
Are sanitizing systems effective against all types of bacteria and viruses?
Sanitizing systems are made to fight many types of bacteria and viruses. However, how well they work can depend on the type of sanitizer and the existing germs.
What is commercial disinfecting?
Commercial disinfecting involves using specialized chemicals and equipment to eliminate germs, bacteria and viruses from surfaces in commercial settings. This process helps prevent the spread of infectious diseases and ensures a safe environment for employees, customers and visitors.
Are all disinfectant wipes safe for food contact surfaces?
Not all disinfectant wipes are harmless for surfaces that touch food. It is important to read the labels closely to make sure the wipes are marked as safe for use on food contact surfaces.
What is the difference between commercial and household disinfectants?
Commercial disinfectants are specifically formulated to meet the stringent requirements of various industries such as food service, commercial kitchens, janitorial & sanitation and industrial hygiene. They are designed to eliminate a wider range of pathogens and maintain high levels of cleanliness in demanding environments. On the other hand, household disinfectants are generally milder and primarily used for routine cleaning in residential settings. They may not be as effective against certain types of germs or suitable for use on surfaces that come into contact with food or require heavy-duty disinfection.
Still have questions?
markdown:
# Food Safe Wipes | D2 Disinfectant Wipes

[![Alpet D2 Quat Surface Sanitizer](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/639cc74f84d8d4077f6a25a1/66e06febede411dc1ae5dffd_D2-Wipes_1280x.png)](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/product/alpet-d2-surface-sanitizing-wipes)

### Alpet D2 Surface Sanitizing Wipes

Alpet D2 Surface Sanitizing Wipes are a ready-to-use, no-rinse, lintless wiping system for food contact surfaces. They are available in a 90-count heavy duty wipe canister and a 160-count medium duty wipe canister. As with all Best Sanitizers wiping systems, the spring-loaded lid closes on its own to prevent the drying of wipes, helping to eliminate unnecessary waste.

*   Clean and sanitize with one product
*   Sanitizes food contact and non-food contact surfaces
*   Kills 99.999% of _Staphylococcus aureus_, _Escherichia coli_, _Salmonella enterica_ (formerly typhimurium) and _Listeria monocytogenes_ as a food contact surface sanitizer
*   Kills 99.9% of tested pathogens in 10 seconds as a non-food contact surface sanitizer
*   58% IPA/quat formula ideal for water sensitive equipment
*   Strong, lintless wipes for food contact surfaces
*   Spring-loaded lid to prevent drying
*   Ready-to-use, no-rinse required
*   NSF listed D2 classification
*   Kosher, Pareve and Halal certified

## What Makes D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes Food Safe?

The main difference between regular disinfectant wipes and D2 Sanitizers surface sanitizing wipes are the ingredients. D2 wipes have alcohol or other risk-free agents that can be used when cleaning food areas, which kill 99.999% of germs such as _Staphylococcus aureus_, _Escherichia coli_, _Salmonella enterica_ (formerly typhimurium) and _Listeria monocytogenes_.  

When choosing surface sanitizing food safe wipes, it's important to check for approvals from trusted groups like the NSF (National Sanitation Foundation). NSF listed products meet rigorous safety and efficacy standards, ensuring they are suitable for use in environments where food or high sanitation cleaning is critical.  

![Food Safe Wipes](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713ab2ce912e725f19926fe_D2-Wipes-w-Bowl-Kitchen_cropped.jpg)

## The Benefits of Using D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes in the Kitchen

Using D2 Sanitizing surface sanitizing wipes in your kitchen is a great way to keep things clean and make your cleaning easier. These wipes are a ready-to-use, no-rinse and lintless wiping system for food contact surfaces. This helps you keep your food protected, so you can feel good knowing your kitchen is clean.

Surface sanitizing wipes also make cleaning simpler. You don’t need to use sprays or different cleaning products. Just grab a wipe, clean the surface, and throw it away. It's really that simple!  

Also, with all D2 Sanitizers wipes, the spring-loaded lid closes on its own to prevent the drying of wipes, helping to eliminate unnecessary waste.

![Food Safe Wipes](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713ab2de912e725f1992771_Food_Safe_Wipes_1.jpg)

### Enhancing Food Safety Protocols with D2 Sanitizers Surface Sanitizing Wipes

Food safety should come first in every kitchen. Using D2 Sanitizing surface sanitizing wipes in your daily cleaning can help a lot. Wiping down surfaces where food touches before and after use can keep harmful bacteria at bay. This way, you lower the chance of germs and food illnesses.

Food service places, like restaurants and cafes, can also gain from using D2 Sanitizers surface sanitizing wipes. These businesses need to follow strict health rules. By using the right sanitizing wipes, especially those that are NSF listed, they can meet health standards while keeping a protected place for customers.

Whether you cook at home or work as a chef, using surface sanitizing disinfectant wipes shows you care about a clean kitchen. This care for food safety protects your health and builds trust with people who enjoy what you cook.

![Food Safe Wipes](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713ab2de912e725f1992791_Food_Safe_Wipes_2.jpg)

### D2 Sanitizers Quick and Efficient Surface Sanitizing Wipes

Time is valuable, especially in a busy kitchen. D2 wipes offer a quick way to cleaning workspaces without losing effectiveness. These wipes are soaked with the right amount of cleaning agents, so you don’t have to measure or mix anything.

Some of the main benefits of using surface sanitizing wipes for cleaning surfaces in the kitchen:

*   **Saves Time:** Just grab a wipe, clean the surface, and throw it away. There is no need to rinse or dry.
*   **Easy to Use:** Many food sanitizing wipes come in small packages. This makes them simple to store in drawers or keep nearby for fast cleanups.
*   **Flexible:** You can use these wipes on many types of food contact surfaces, such as counters, cutting boards, sinks, and appliances.

Keeping food contact surfaces protected in your kitchen is very important. Choosing the right sanitizing wipe can greatly improve how you ensure food safety. These wipes allow for quick and easy cleaning of surfaces. By using good quality wipes meant for food contact surfaces, you can keep your kitchen clean and secure.

![Food Safe Wipes](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713ab2de912e725f199273c_Food_Safe_Wipes_3.jpg)

## Sanitizing Wipes FAQs

Do I need to wear gloves when applying this product to surfaces?

This product **does not require** gloves to be worn when sanitizing high touch, hard surfaces. If you have sensitive skin, you may want to consider wearing gloves simply as a precaution.

What is Alpet D2 used for?

Alpet D2 is an effective disinfectant that kills viruses like norovirus on hard, food and non-food contact surfaces. The purpose of an Alpet D2 formula spray or wipe is to eliminate tested pathogens, keep your facility clean and protect consumers from sickness.

What is the difference between disinfecting and sanitizing wipes?

Sanitization removes bacterial particles using chemical substances and fights against viruses. Alpet D2 is an EPA-approved product with powerful efficacy and response time for eliminating strep, norovirus and listeria. Disinfecting with chemicals means it will completely eliminate contaminants from surfaces.

What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?

Contact to sensitive parts of the body may result in a stinging feeling or slight irritation. This irritation is treatable. If contact has been made with the eyes, gently rinse eyes with water as soon as possible. It may take 15 to 20 minutes to recover. If inhaled or swallowed, get some fresh air and breathe slowly.

If conditions still persist, call your doctor for medical attention.

Does Alpet D2 kill 99.9% of viruses and bacteria including cold flu?

Yes, D2 wipes quickly sanitize 99.9% of tested pathogens in 10 seconds. Active ingredients work together on equipment and other surfaces for fast disinfection, leaving a positive and lasting impression. Within 60 seconds, the disinfectant will have a higher chance to eliminate more bacteria including cold, flu and strep—up to 99.999%.

Where is Alpet No-Rinse Quat Sanitizer frequently used?

Alpet No-Rinse Quat Sanitizer is one of the most versatile chemicals, as it is used to disinfect in government buildings, hospital applications, restaurants and open air market applications. It can be made into an easy spray and into a disinfectant wipe for walls and tables.

Quats are ammonium salts that have a positively-charged nitrogen atom at their center. This basic molecule can be modified in many different ways to create quat-based compounds, which are then used as sanitizers and disinfectants. (Note: Quats have NO ODOR. Ammonium is not ammonia.)

What is the difference between Smart-San cleaning wipes and Alpet D2 surface sanitizing wipes?

The main distinction between these wipes is the purpose of application and design for consumers. Alpet D2 is a highly powerful disinfectant for food contact surfaces and food manufacturing facilities. However, Smart-San is a sanitizer for personal cleaning to kill germs on the body and other surfaces.

Is a sanitizing spray bottle or wipe better for cleaning?

Wipes are more powerful than spraying and using a cloth. When using a cloth and spray, you can create uneven coverage and reduce the effectiveness of the cleaner. Wipes are the most reliable option for cleaning high-infection areas and eliminating more bacteria on surfaces.

Where can I use Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes?

Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes work well for households, office spaces and public buildings. While manufacturers may purchase the wipes, this product is not designed to kill bacteria on food contact surfaces. Smart-San wipes are a best seller for cleaning bathrooms, glass, walls and more.

Are there harsh chemicals in Smart-San All-Purpose wipes?

No, Smart-San All-Purpose Wipes contain two main active ingredients: ethanol and isopropyl. Neither component is tough on skin or harmful to users.

What is the benzalkonium chloride (BAC) formula?

Benzalkonium chloride (BAC) is an active ingredient in household cleaners, hand sanitizers and many liquid soaps, including disinfectant soaps. As an antimicrobial agent, the BAC formula disrupts the functionality of many pathogens such as bacteria, viruses and fungi. Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.

Is peracetic acid safe for use on all food contact surfaces?

Peracetic acid is safe for many food contact surfaces since it breaks down into harmless substances. However, it’s important to think about how you use it. You need to consider the type of surface, how long it stays in contact, the pH value and any organic matter. These factors can affect how well it works and its safety.

How often should surfaces be sanitized in a food processing area?

Surfaces in food processing areas can get contaminated by bacteria like _Salmonella_ and norovirus, so it is important to clean and sanitize them often with a foodservice surface sanitizer spray. Sanitize whenever there is a chance of contamination and at least every four hours. Use the right amount, which is usually a few fluid ounces per gallon of water, and rinse if needed. The cleaning frequency may change based on the product you use and how you apply it.

Can D2 Sanitizers products be used on all types of food contact surface?

D2 Sanitizers products are very versatile. The surface sanitizer spray is highly effective, quickly cleaning and disinfecting a variety of food contact surface. Our products work well on many hard and soft surfaces. However, always look at the product label to see if it is safe for a specific surface. If you are unsure, you can try a quick test on a hidden spot to check if the material is safe.

Are D2 Sanitizers products safe for use around food and customers?

D2 Sanitizers focuses on keeping food safe. Our products follow strict industry rules and are safe to use on food contact surfaces, as long as you use them correctly. They are also highly effective in eliminating human coronavirus quickly and efficiently on food-contact surfaces, ensuring a safe dining environment. There are precautionary statements on the packaging to help guide you, just like with hand soaps or cleaners.

What are the benefits of using a D2 Sanitizers footwear sanitizing system in food service?

Sanitizing systems play a vital role in maintaining cleanliness and safety in food service environments. By reducing the risk of cross-contamination, these systems enhance food safety, protect public health and contribute to a better customer experience.

Are sanitizing systems effective against all types of bacteria and viruses?

Sanitizing systems are made to fight many types of bacteria and viruses. However, how well they work can depend on the type of sanitizer and the existing germs.

What is commercial disinfecting?

Commercial disinfecting involves using specialized chemicals and equipment to eliminate germs, bacteria and viruses from surfaces in commercial settings. This process helps prevent the spread of infectious diseases and ensures a safe environment for employees, customers and visitors.

Are all disinfectant wipes safe for food contact surfaces?

Not all disinfectant wipes are harmless for surfaces that touch food. It is important to read the labels closely to make sure the wipes are marked as safe for use on food contact surfaces.

What is the difference between commercial and household disinfectants?

Commercial disinfectants are specifically formulated to meet the stringent requirements of various industries such as food service, commercial kitchens, janitorial & sanitation and industrial hygiene. They are designed to eliminate a wider range of pathogens and maintain high levels of cleanliness in demanding environments. On the other hand, household disinfectants are generally milder and primarily used for routine cleaning in residential settings. They may not be as effective against certain types of germs or suitable for use on surfaces that come into contact with food or require heavy-duty disinfection.

### Still have questions?

text:
Advanced Chemical Dispenser System | D2 Sanitizers
Types of Chemical Dispensers
Different types of dispensers meet different needs in a food service area. Types of dispensers include touchless hand sanitizer dispensers, automatic soap dispensers, sink dispensers and foam soap dispensers.
Touchless Hand Sanitizer Dispenser
Touchless hand sanitizer dispensers are now very popular, especially in places like restaurants. These dispensers help stop germs from spreading. They use special sensors to notice when hands are near and give out the right amount of sanitizer automatically.
Benefits of touchless hand sanitizer dispensers include:
Reduced Cross-Contamination: You don’t have to touch the dispenser, which helps keep germs away.
Enhanced Hygiene: They encourage everyone to clean their hands regularly.
Cost-Effective: These dispensers give out just the right amount of sanitizer. This cuts down on waste and saves money.
Improved Convenience: They allow you to sanitize your hands without touching anything, making them easy to use.
D2 Sanitizers Specializes in Delivering Chemical Dispensing Options for Food Service
In the changing world of food service, keeping hygiene standards high is very important. To outshine the competition and create a safe, healthy space, food service businesses are using advanced dispenser systems for chemicals. These multi-functional systems provide a smart way to dispense and manage chemicals, facilitating easy and precise dispensing to avoid spills, reduce waste and ensure a controlled dosage for effective chemical use. They are changing how we sanitize and setting new industry standards.
Automatic Soap Dispenser
Automatic soap dispensers are like touchless hand sanitizer dispensers. They provide a clean and efficient way to wash hands in places where food is served. These dispensers use sensors to release the right amount of soap. This way, you can keep your hands clean without needing to push any buttons.
Benefits of automatic soap dispensers include:
Better Hygiene: These dispensers help ensure you wash your hands properly by giving the right amount of soap.
Less Waste: They reduce soap waste, which can happen with manual dispensers.
More Convenience: These systems are hands-free and easy to use.
Stylish Look: They improve the appearance of restrooms and washing areas.
Foam Soap Dispenser
Foam soap dispensers provide rich, foamy soap that helps clean away dirt and germs. These dispensers offer soap in a foamy form, which uses less water. This means you need less soap for each hand wash.
Benefits of foam soap dispensers include:
Effective Cleaning: They create thick, soft foam that helps remove dirt and bacteria.
Water Conservation: They need less water than regular liquid soap dispensers.
Cost Savings: They cut down soap use because of the pre-foamed soap.
Gentle on Skin: They are often made with softer ingredients, so they are safe for sensitive skin.

The Importance of Advanced Chemical Dispensing
Food service operations must follow strict hygiene rules. Advanced chemical dispensers are essential for keeping these standards. Dispensers help in measuring and mixing cleaning solutions accurately. With these dispensers, businesses can prepare sanitizers correctly. This reduces the chance of mistakes that can happen with manual mixing. Businesses can save up to 30% on chemical costs through reliable and precise dosing.
These advanced dispensers provide a steady mix that is hard to achieve manually. This steady mix is important for the effectiveness of cleaning agents. It ensures that the solutions always have the proper strength for the best sanitation.
Ensuring Safety and Compliance in Food Sanitation
Advanced chemical dispensers help improve safety in food service, reducing direct contact with strong chemicals. This helps lower the chances of spills, splashes and accidents to keep employees safe.
These dispensers dose cleaning solutions accurately. This means they follow safety rules and don’t make mixtures that are too strong, which can be harmful. It is important for keeping to food safety rules and ensuring the safety of both staff and customers.
Using these dispensers automates the process of mixing chemicals. This means there are fewer mistakes compared to doing it by hand. It helps make sure that cleaning is done at the highest safety standards every time.
Boosting Efficiency with Innovative Dispensing Solutions
Chemical dispensers help make operations faster and smoother. These systems speed up cleaning by giving easy access to pre-diluted solutions. This cuts out the slow work of mixing the solutions by hand. These systems are adaptable for operations of any size, from small to large installations.
Automated dispensers improve efficiency, providing the right amount of cleaning solution each time. This saves time and ensures cleaning is done consistently, so every surface gets the right treatment.
With these tasks made easier, advanced dispensers allow staff to focus on other important areas of food service. This leads to better overall efficiency and happier customers.
Sink Dispenser
Sink dispensers are often built into or placed near sinks. They are meant to give you dishwashing liquid, hand soap or sanitizer when you need it. This makes it easier to keep things clean in areas where you prepare food or wash your hands.
Benefits of sink dispensers include:
Convenience: You can easily get cleaning products without needing separate bottles.
Space Saving: They reduce mess around sinks by storing cleaning solutions in one place.
Improved Organization: They help keep kitchens and handwashing spots tidy and efficient.
Enhanced Aesthetics: They look more stylish and professional than regular soap bottles.
Implementation and Support
Implementing a chemical dispenser system requires careful planning and execution to ensure a smooth transition and optimal performance. This process includes training personnel on the system’s operation and maintenance, providing technical support and monitoring the system’s performance to identify any issues or areas for improvement.
Ongoing support and maintenance are crucial to ensuring the system continues to operate reliably and efficiently over time. Regular check-ups and updates help maintain the system’s performance, ensuring it remains a valuable asset in delivering accurate and safe chemical dispensing solutions.
Dispensing Options FAQs
How do I clean and maintain the Foam Unit?
Regular maintenance ensures your Foam Unit stays in excellent working condition. Here are the steps to clean and maintain it:
• Flush the system: After each use, run clean water through the unit to flush out any remaining cleaning solution.
• Inspect components: Check hoses, fittings, and nozzles for wear or damage. Replace any worn parts as needed.
• Clean the tank: Periodically clean the tank with mild soap and water to remove residue and prevent buildup.
• Charge the battery: Fully charge the lithium-ion battery after each use to ensure it’s ready for the next session.
• Store properly: Keep the unit in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight or extreme temperatures.
Can I use any cleaning solution with the Foam Unit?
Yes, our Foam Units are compatible with a wide range of cleaning and sanitizing solutions, including disinfectants, detergents, and degreasers. However, we recommend using solutions specifically designed for foaming applications to ensure optimal performance. Always follow the manufacturer’s guidelines for dilution ratios and application methods to avoid damage to the unit or surfaces being cleaned.
How does the lithium-ion battery improve cleaning efficiency?
The lithium-ion battery provides cordless operation, eliminating the need to stay near power outlets or manage extension cords. This feature allows for greater mobility and efficiency, especially in large facilities or areas with limited access to electrical outlets. The battery is long-lasting and designed to support multiple cleaning sessions on a single charge. Recharge time is minimal, ensuring you can keep your cleaning operations running smoothly.
What sizes are available for the Foam Units, and how do I choose the right one for my needs?
We offer Foam Units in many sizes. The guides below will help you choose
• 10-Gallon Unit: Ideal for smaller spaces or businesses that require frequent portability, such as small commercial kitchens or automotive detailing.
• 20-Gallon Unit: A mid-range option perfect for medium-scale operations, such as farms, breweries, or moderate manufacturing facilities.
• 30-Gallon Unit: Best suited for large-scale cleaning tasks, such as in food processing plants, large animal housing, or industrial facilities.
To choose the right size, consider the scale of your cleaning operations, the amount of foam solution needed per session, and whether mobility or larger capacity is a higher priority for your business.
What factors should be considered when selecting a chemical dispenser for a 3 compartment sink?
When selecting a chemical dispenser, consider the dispenser’s compatibility with the sink system, its ease of installation and its ability to dispense multiple chemicals accurately. Other factors include reliability, user-friendliness and whether it supports the specific chemicals your kitchen uses. Look for dispensers that are durable and made from materials that can withstand regular exposure to cleaning agents. Cost-effectiveness, warranty and customer support are also valuable considerations.
The DEMA PRO-FILL 2 Sink Dispenser is packaged in a convenient box with all necessary components for easy setup and use.
How can a chemical dispenser improve efficiency and safety in a commercial kitchen setting?
Chemical dispensers improve efficiency by automating the accurate dispensing of cleaning and sanitizing agents, reducing time spent measuring and mixing chemicals manually. This minimizes handling, which improves safety for kitchen staff by lowering exposure to concentrated chemicals. Consistent and precise dosing also ensures compliance with health standards, helping to maintain a safer food preparation area.
How does a chemical dispenser work in a 3 compartment sink?
A chemical dispenser is connected to each sink compartment to automatically mix and dispense the correct amount of cleaning solution, rinse water and sanitizer. By controlling the flow and concentration of each chemical, the dispenser simplifies the process, ensuring consistent, effective cleaning and sanitizing in each step of the 3 compartment system.
What are the benefits of using a chemical dispenser in a 3 compartment sink?
Using a chemical dispenser in a 3 compartment sink offers several advantages, including accurate chemical mixing, consistent dosing and reduced waste. This ensures effective cleaning and sanitization while saving time and reducing errors in chemical handling. Additionally, dispensers help maintain proper sanitization levels to meet health regulations, promoting a safe kitchen environment.
How do I install and maintain the VersaClenz dispenser?
Installation is simple with the included mounting hardware and template. For maintenance, it’s easy to refill and features a tamper-resistant lock to prevent unauthorized access and ensure hygiene supplies stay secure.
What types of hygiene products can the VersaClenz Manual Dispenser hold?
The VersaClenz dispenser is designed to be compatible with various hand hygiene products, including hand sanitizer, soap and lotion. It accommodates multiple refill sizes, making it versatile for different applications.
Who do I contact for bulk product orders?
You can reach a D2 Sanitizers representative by sending an email to mike@d2sanitizers.com, giving us a call at (762) 255-8353 or filling out our contact form.
We would love to hear your feedback! Please leave a product and customer service review.
What considerations should be made when choosing a chemical dispenser?
When picking a chemical dispenser, think about what you really need. Focus on features that can solve your current problems, such as cutting waste, improving safety or making tasks easier. Consider the types of chemicals you use, the amount you need and the space you have for installation. This will help you find the right dispenser.
What are the key features of advanced chemical dispensers?
Advanced chemical dispensers have many features that focus on safety and following rules. They also help improve efficiency. Key features include accurate dosing systems, easy-to-use interfaces and strong construction. This means they are made to last a long time.
How do chemical dispensers improve food service sanitation?
Chemical dispensers are changing the way we keep food service areas clean. These dispensers use different safety features that help make sure that the right amounts of chemicals are used. It also reduces the chances of contamination. Overall, this leads to better hygiene.
Can advanced dispensers reduce waste and overuse of chemicals?
Yes, advanced dispensers are made to work efficiently. They solve the problems of waste and overuse found in older methods. Their multi systems guarantee accurate doses, which lowers the use of chemicals and helps the environment.
Are chemical dispenser systems used in other industries?
Chemical dispenser systems are used across a variety of industries, providing accurate, safe and cost-effective dosing solutions. These systems ensure consistent results and minimize waste, making them a reliable choice for many applications.
In commercial cleaning, chemical dispensers are used to sanitize floors, surfaces and equipment, ensuring a clean and safe environment. In the laundry sector, these systems deliver precise amounts of detergent and other chemicals to washing machines, guaranteeing optimal cleaning results every time.
Still have questions?

These multi-functional systems provide a smart way to dispense and manage chemicals, facilitating easy and precise dispensing to avoid spills, reduce waste and ensure a controlled dosage for effective chemical use. They are changing how we sanitize and setting new industry standards.

![Chemical Dispensing ](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713adc09ba04f04d7ddbc73_d2sanitizer_dispensers_22.jpg)

![Automatic Soap Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713adbf9ba04f04d7ddbbef_DISPENSER_AUTO_1000X1000.png)

### Automatic Soap Dispenser

Automatic soap dispensers are like touchless hand sanitizer dispensers. They provide a clean and efficient way to wash hands in places where food is served. These dispensers use sensors to release the right amount of soap. This way, you can keep your hands clean without needing to push any buttons.

Benefits of automatic soap dispensers include:

*   **Better Hygiene:** These dispensers help ensure you wash your hands properly by giving the right amount of soap.
*   **Less Waste:** They reduce soap waste, which can happen with manual dispensers.
*   **More Convenience:** These systems are hands-free and easy to use.
*   **Stylish Look:** They improve the appearance of restrooms and washing areas.

### Foam Soap Dispenser

Foam soap dispensers provide rich, foamy soap that helps clean away dirt and germs. These dispensers offer soap in a foamy form, which uses less water. This means you need less soap for each hand wash.

Benefits of foam soap dispensers include:

*   **Effective Cleaning:** They create thick, soft foam that helps remove dirt and bacteria.
*   **Water Conservation:** They need less water than regular liquid soap dispensers.
*   **Cost Savings:** They cut down soap use because of the pre-foamed soap.
*   **Gentle on Skin:** They are often made with softer ingredients, so they are safe for sensitive skin.

![Foam Soap Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713adbf9ba04f04d7ddbc00_Open-VC-w-text-1024.jpg)

![Foamers](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/672e6b90555dce7f6c1736f5_Pump-Up-Foamer-cat-image_9271c796-c935-400a-9f56-201131dc2c7f.png)

### Foamers

$1,680.00

![Trench Drain Foaming Attachment](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/671b9ce75b8a3217d5336733_TrenchDrainFoamingAttachment.jpeg)

### Trench Drain Foaming Attachment

$0.00

![Drain Foaming Attachment](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/671b9c6f4add359188a84df9_DrainFoamingAttachment.png)

### Drain Foaming Attachment

![Airless SmartStep D2 Sanitizers Footwear Sanitizing Systems](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/672e831c0c1d95cca55cf878_Airless_smart_step_1.jpeg)

### Airless SmartStep D2 Sanitizers Footwear Sanitizing Systems

![DEMA PRO-FILL 2: 3 Compartment Sink Chemical Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/67116f414b682cb88937709a_dema_pro-fill2_900x900_729eb257-6f11-48b6-ac8c-b588e77fa25f.jpeg)

### DEMA PRO-FILL 2: 3 Compartment Sink Chemical Dispenser

$199.00

![EZ Step Wall-Mounted Foot-Activated Hand Sanitizer Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/67116f414b682cb889377023_MD10105-10-EZ-Step-Wall-Mount-Dispenser-w-E3-1024.jpeg)

### EZ Step Wall-Mounted Foot-Activated Hand Sanitizer Dispenser

$209.00

![EZ Step Portable, Foot-Activated Hand Sanitizer Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/67116f414b682cb88937700e_MD10012-EZ-Step-Portable-Dispenser-w-E3-1024.jpeg)

### EZ Step Portable, Foot-Activated Hand Sanitizer Dispenser

$929.00

![VersaClenz Touchless Hand Hygiene Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/67116f414b682cb88937702c_VC-Touchless-Disp-Pair-1024.jpeg)

### VersaClenz Touchless Hand Hygiene Dispenser

![VersaClenz Manual Hand Hygiene Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b4a7365cecb0df17e7/67116f414b682cb88937702f_VC-Manual-Disp-Pair.jpeg)

### VersaClenz Manual Hand Hygiene Dispenser

$27.00

## The Importance of Advanced Chemical Dispensing

Food service operations must follow strict hygiene rules. Advanced chemical dispensers are essential for keeping these standards. Dispensers help in measuring and mixing cleaning solutions accurately. With these dispensers, businesses can prepare sanitizers correctly. This reduces the chance of mistakes that can happen with manual mixing. Businesses can save up to 30% on chemical costs through reliable and precise dosing.

These advanced dispensers provide a steady mix that is hard to achieve manually. This steady mix is important for the effectiveness of cleaning agents. It ensures that the solutions always have the proper strength for the best sanitation.

### Ensuring Safety and Compliance in Food Sanitation

Advanced chemical dispensers help improve safety in food service, reducing direct contact with strong chemicals. This helps lower the chances of spills, splashes and accidents to keep employees safe.

These dispensers dose cleaning solutions accurately. This means they follow safety rules and don’t make mixtures that are too strong, which can be harmful. It is important for keeping to food safety rules and ensuring the safety of both staff and customers.

Using these dispensers automates the process of mixing chemicals. This means there are fewer mistakes compared to doing it by hand. It helps make sure that cleaning is done at the highest safety standards every time.

### Boosting Efficiency with Innovative Dispensing Solutions

Chemical dispensers help make operations faster and smoother. These systems speed up cleaning by giving easy access to pre-diluted solutions. This cuts out the slow work of mixing the solutions by hand. These systems are adaptable for operations of any size, from small to large installations.

Automated dispensers improve efficiency, providing the right amount of cleaning solution each time. This saves time and ensures cleaning is done consistently, so every surface gets the right treatment.

With these tasks made easier, advanced dispensers allow staff to focus on other important areas of food service. This leads to better overall efficiency and happier customers.

![Sink Dispenser](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713adc09ba04f04d7ddbc4a_DEMA_PRO-FILL2_900X900.jpg)

### Sink Dispenser

Sink dispensers are often built into or placed near sinks. They are meant to give you dishwashing liquid, hand soap or sanitizer when you need it. This makes it easier to keep things clean in areas where you prepare food or wash your hands.

Benefits of sink dispensers include:

*   **Convenience:** You can easily get cleaning products without needing separate bottles.
*   **Space Saving:** They reduce mess around sinks by storing cleaning solutions in one place.
*   **Improved Organization:** They help keep kitchens and handwashing spots tidy and efficient.
*   **Enhanced Aesthetics:** They look more stylish and professional than regular soap bottles.

## Implementation and Support

Implementing a chemical dispenser system requires careful planning and execution to ensure a smooth transition and optimal performance. This process includes training personnel on the system’s operation and maintenance, providing technical support and monitoring the system’s performance to identify any issues or areas for improvement.

Ongoing support and maintenance are crucial to ensuring the system continues to operate reliably and efficiently over time. Regular check-ups and updates help maintain the system’s performance, ensuring it remains a valuable asset in delivering accurate and safe chemical dispensing solutions.

![Chemical Dispensing ](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/671129b3a7365cecb0df175c/6713adbf9ba04f04d7ddbb82_d2sanitizers_20.jpg)

## Dispensing Options FAQs

How do I clean and maintain the Foam Unit?

Regular maintenance ensures your Foam Unit stays in excellent working condition. Here are the steps to clean and maintain it:

• **Flush the system**: After each use, run clean water through the unit to flush out any remaining cleaning solution.

• **Inspect components**: Check hoses, fittings, and nozzles for wear or damage. Replace any worn parts as needed.

• **Clean the tank**: Periodically clean the tank with mild soap and water to remove residue and prevent buildup.

• **Charge the battery**: Fully charge the lithium-ion battery after each use to ensure it’s ready for the next session.

• **Store properly**: Keep the unit in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight or extreme temperatures.

Can I use any cleaning solution with the Foam Unit?

Yes, our Foam Units are compatible with a wide range of cleaning and sanitizing solutions, including disinfectants, detergents, and degreasers. However, we recommend using solutions specifically designed for foaming applications to ensure optimal performance. Always follow the manufacturer’s guidelines for dilution ratios and application methods to avoid damage to the unit or surfaces being cleaned.

How does the lithium-ion battery improve cleaning efficiency?

The lithium-ion battery provides cordless operation, eliminating the need to stay near power outlets or manage extension cords. This feature allows for greater mobility and efficiency, especially in large facilities or areas with limited access to electrical outlets. The battery is long-lasting and designed to support multiple cleaning sessions on a single charge. Recharge time is minimal, ensuring you can keep your cleaning operations running smoothly.

What sizes are available for the Foam Units, and how do I choose the right one for my needs?

We offer Foam Units in many sizes. The guides below will help you choose

• **10-Gallon Unit**: Ideal for smaller spaces or businesses that require frequent portability, such as small commercial kitchens or automotive detailing.

• **20-Gallon Unit**: A mid-range option perfect for medium-scale operations, such as farms, breweries, or moderate manufacturing facilities.

• **30-Gallon Unit**: Best suited for large-scale cleaning tasks, such as in food processing plants, large animal housing, or industrial facilities.  

To choose the right size, consider the scale of your cleaning operations, the amount of foam solution needed per session, and whether mobility or larger capacity is a higher priority for your business.

What factors should be considered when selecting a chemical dispenser for a 3 compartment sink?

When selecting a chemical dispenser, consider the dispenser’s compatibility with the sink system, its ease of installation and its ability to dispense multiple chemicals accurately. Other factors include reliability, user-friendliness and whether it supports the specific chemicals your kitchen uses. Look for dispensers that are durable and made from materials that can withstand regular exposure to cleaning agents. Cost-effectiveness, warranty and customer support are also valuable considerations.

The DEMA PRO-FILL 2 Sink Dispenser is packaged in a convenient box with all necessary components for easy setup and use.

How can a chemical dispenser improve efficiency and safety in a commercial kitchen setting?

Chemical dispensers improve efficiency by automating the accurate dispensing of cleaning and sanitizing agents, reducing time spent measuring and mixing chemicals manually. This minimizes handling, which improves safety for kitchen staff by lowering exposure to concentrated chemicals. Consistent and precise dosing also ensures compliance with health standards, helping to maintain a safer food preparation area.

How does a chemical dispenser work in a 3 compartment sink?

A chemical dispenser is connected to each sink compartment to automatically mix and dispense the correct amount of cleaning solution, rinse water and sanitizer. By controlling the flow and concentration of each chemical, the dispenser simplifies the process, ensuring consistent, effective cleaning and sanitizing in each step of the 3 compartment system.

What are the benefits of using a chemical dispenser in a 3 compartment sink?

Using a chemical dispenser in a 3 compartment sink offers several advantages, including accurate chemical mixing, consistent dosing and reduced waste. This ensures effective cleaning and sanitization while saving time and reducing errors in chemical handling. Additionally, dispensers help maintain proper sanitization levels to meet health regulations, promoting a safe kitchen environment.

How do I install and maintain the VersaClenz dispenser?

Installation is simple with the included mounting hardware and template. For maintenance, it’s easy to refill and features a tamper-resistant lock to prevent unauthorized access and ensure hygiene supplies stay secure.

What types of hygiene products can the VersaClenz Manual Dispenser hold?

The VersaClenz dispenser is designed to be compatible with various hand hygiene products, including hand sanitizer, soap and lotion. It accommodates multiple refill sizes, making it versatile for different applications.

Who do I contact for bulk product orders?

You can reach a D2 Sanitizers representative by sending an email to mike@d2sanitizers.com, giving us a call at (762) 255-8353 or filling out our [**contact**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/contact) form.

We would love to hear your feedback! Please leave a product and customer service review.

What considerations should be made when choosing a chemical dispenser?

When picking a chemical dispenser, think about what you really need. Focus on features that can solve your current problems, such as cutting waste, improving safety or making tasks easier. Consider the types of chemicals you use, the amount you need and the space you have for installation. This will help you find the right dispenser.

What are the key features of advanced chemical dispensers?

Advanced chemical dispensers have many features that focus on safety and following rules. They also help improve efficiency. Key features include accurate dosing systems, easy-to-use interfaces and strong construction. This means they are made to last a long time.

How do chemical dispensers improve food service sanitation?

Chemical dispensers are changing the way we keep food service areas clean. These dispensers use different safety features that help make sure that the right amounts of chemicals are used. It also reduces the chances of contamination. Overall, this leads to better hygiene.

Can advanced dispensers reduce waste and overuse of chemicals?

Yes, advanced dispensers are made to work efficiently. They solve the problems of waste and overuse found in older methods. Their multi systems guarantee accurate doses, which lowers the use of chemicals and helps the environment.

Are chemical dispenser systems used in other industries?

Chemical dispenser systems are used across a variety of industries, providing accurate, safe and cost-effective dosing solutions. These systems ensure consistent results and minimize waste, making them a reliable choice for many applications.

In commercial cleaning, chemical dispensers are used to sanitize floors, surfaces and equipment, ensuring a clean and safe environment. In the laundry sector, these systems deliver precise amounts of detergent and other chemicals to washing machines, guaranteeing optimal cleaning results every time.

### Still have questions?

text:
Industrial Hand Soap | D2 Sanitizers
Reduce the Risk of Contamination
Hand hygiene plays a crucial role in maintaining food safety, as hands can easily transfer harmful bacteria and viruses. By implementing proper hand hygiene practices, food businesses can manage compliance, reduce the risk of contamination and protect their customers' health. That's why our industrial soaps are specifically formulated for the food industry.
Our hand soaps combat a broad spectrum of bacteria, viruses and fungi. To maintain both a healthy work environment and product safety, choose from our wide range of hand soaps for effective cleaning and protection against germs. With our industrial strength soaps, you can meet regulatory requirements and uphold rigorous cleanliness standards with ease.
Revolutionizing Hand Hygiene
Through powerful disinfecting agents, our hand soaps effectively eliminate a wide range of pathogens, including E. coli and Salmonella. These industrial strength hand soaps not only remove dirt, grease and bacteria from dirty hands, but also protect the skin to reduce the risk of dermatitis and other skin issues.
Regular hand washing with our soaps significantly reduces the risk of food-borne illnesses and enhances overall sanitation practices in food manufacturing and processing facilities. By incorporating our hand soaps in your facility, you ensure product safety and maintain a clean environment for both workers and consumers.
Industrial Hand Soap Products
Formulated for the most demanding environments, our hand soaps are designed to eradicate germs and bacteria instantly, leaving your hands impeccably clean. From foam hand soaps to liquid hand soaps, choose from a wide range of options. Our products are specially designed to combat dirt, heavy grease and grime without compromising the skin's integrity.
Dispensing Options
D2 Sanitizers provides a diverse selection of soap dispensers suitable for different industries and settings. Our dispensers are built to withstand heavy use, guaranteeing long-lasting functionality. Choose from a variety of manual and automatic options for convenient hand hygiene practices.
Leading Soap Supplier in the Southeast
As a trusted soap supplier in the Southeast, D2 Sanitizers offers a wide range of sanitation products for various industries with a focus on food processing. Through our strong commitment to safety and cleanliness, we meet industry guidelines and provide reliable solutions.
Cleanliness is crucial in the food manufacturing and processing industry for product safety and consumer health. Hand hygiene plays a vital role in maintaining cleanliness, and industrial strength soaps are designed for this purpose. At D2 Sanitizers, our products help maintain hygiene regulations, reduce contamination risks and operate at the highest level of safety and quality. With top-notch customer support, competitive pricing and fast shipping, D2 Sanitizers is your trusted supplier in the Southeast. Contact us today for a quote and experience the difference our products can make in maintaining clean hands and a safe work environment.
Industrial Hand Soaps
D2 Sanitizers provides a comprehensive selection of hand soaps for industrial settings. With gentle formulations and moisturizing properties, our hand soaps ensure optimal hand hygiene while preventing dryness and irritation—even with frequent washing. As a leading industrial soap company, we prioritize quality, safety and customer satisfaction.
Foaming Hand Soap
Foam hand soaps offer a convenient, effective solution to hand hygiene and overall cleanliness in industrial settings. With a rich lather and various scents and formulations, our foaming hand soaps are gentle on the skin and suitable for frequent use.
Liquid Hand Soap
Our liquid hand soaps are formulated to effectively remove dirt, grease, oil, and grime while preserving skin integrity. With gentle, powerful cleansers and moisturizing ingredients, they provide thorough cleaning without causing dryness, keeping your hands soft and comfortable.
Industrial Hand Soaps FAQs
Is E2 foaming soap an antibacterial hand soap?
Yes, Alpet E2 is classified as an antibacterial hand soap. None of the hydrating ingredients are known allergens or harmful to the skin. This antimicrobial soap is designed to keep hands free from bacteria, dirt and grime.
Is foaming hand soap better than liquid soap?
Both types of soaps protect human skin from dirt and germ buildup on the surface of hands. Typical foam soap tends to be slightly less effective because the soap components pump out less frequently. However since Alpet E2 is an antibacterial sanitizing soap, it does not have much of a difference in comparison to liquid soap. Foam soaps are more cost-effective and environment friendly than liquid soaps.
What common chemicals are NOT in this product?
Alpet E1 does not contain artificial colors, dimethyl, alcohol, sodium chloride, lauramine oxide or citric acid.
Who do I contact for bulk product orders?
You can reach a D2 Sanitizers representative by sending an email to mike@d2sanitizers.com, giving us a call at (762) 255-8353 or filling out our contact form.
We would love to hear your feedback! Please leave a product and customer service review.
What are industrial hand soaps?
An industrial hand soap is typically a combination of a hand cleaner and skin conditioners. It is designed to remove tough substances such as dirt, grease and grime on hands and arm region. Best Sanitizers' industrial soaps perform as a heavy duty hand cleaners while moisturizing the skin.
Is this safe for sensitive skin?
Since Alpet E1 is fragrance-free, it is an optimal antibacterial soap for sensitive skin.
Antibacterial soap vs. plain soap: Which is better?
The effectiveness of a soap depends on its purpose and capability to remove dirt and grime when washing the body and hands. Antibacterial soaps contain an ingredient called Triclosan, which protects from infections, disinfects and keep hands clean. This ingredient makes antibacterial products superior for preventing illness and killing germs on hands. However, according to the FDA, there has not been enough research to conclude that antibacterial soaps are safer than plain soaps.
What is the benzalkonium chloride (BAC) formula?
Benzalkonium chloride (BAC) is an active ingredient in household cleaners, hand sanitizers and many liquid soaps, including disinfectant soaps. As an antimicrobial agent, the BAC formula disrupts the functionality of many pathogens such as bacteria, viruses and fungi. Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.
Is this soap an antibacterial soap?
Yes, HACCP Q E2 soap is classified as antibacterial since the soap is able to reduce the amount of bacteria on the skin. Antibacterial soap is able to wipe away pathogens after a hand wash, which bar soap cannot do.
What does HACCP stand for?
HACCP stands for Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points. It is an approach for measuring the safety of products, procedures and prevention inside food production facilities and health care settings. The goal for HACCP is to protect food from spreading illness, like foodborne illness, and assuring that the food is safe and will not harm consumers.
When a product label displays "HACCP," it means that the product is designed to prevent foodborne illness in food production.
What is industrial hand soap?
Industrial hand soap is a specially formulated soap designed for use in industrial settings or other environments that require heavy-duty cleaning. It is specifically engineered to remove tough stains, grease, heavy dirt, oil and other stubborn contaminants from the hands. Industrial hand soaps are typically more powerful and effective than regular soaps, making them ideal for industries such as food manufacturing, construction, automotive and healthcare. These soaps sometimes contain additional ingredients, like pumice or grit, to provide an extra level of scrubbing power. By using industrial hand soap, workers can ensure their hands are thoroughly clean and free of any potentially harmful substances.
What is the advantage of foam hand soap?
Foam hand soap has several advantages over traditional liquid soap. First, the foaming action creates a rich lather that spreads easily across your hands, ensuring thorough coverage and effective cleansing. Second, foam soap uses less water than liquid soap, making it more eco-friendly and cost-effective in the long run. Additionally, foam soap dispensers are designed to deliver the optimum amount of product for each use, reducing waste and saving you money. Lastly, many foam hand soaps are formulated with moisturizing ingredients to keep your skin soft and hydrated, even with frequent use.
What is citric acid powder, and how is it used in soap?
Citric acid powder is a common soap additive used to adjust the pH of the soap and act as a chelating agent. It helps prevent soap scum and improves the soap’s overall texture and effectiveness, especially in hard water areas.
What hand soap do hospitals use?
Hospitals typically use a hand soap that is specifically formulated to meet the rigorous hygiene standards required in healthcare settings. These soaps are designed to effectively kill a wide range of bacteria, viruses and other pathogens, helping to prevent the spread of infections. They often contain antimicrobial agents, such as benzalkonium chloride or chlorhexidine gluconate, which have been proven to effectively eliminate harmful microorganisms. Hospital hand soaps are usually gentle on the skin and may include moisturizing ingredients to prevent dryness and irritation caused by frequent handwashing.
Which hand soap kills the most germs?
When it comes to killing germs, one of the most effective hand soaps is antibacterial soap. Antibacterial hand soaps contain active ingredients, such as triclosan or benzalkonium chloride, which have been proven to eliminate a wide range of harmful microorganisms. These soaps work by disrupting the cell membranes of bacteria, viruses and other germs, effectively killing them on contact. However, it's important to note that regular handwashing with any soap, even non-antibacterial ones, can still help reduce the spread of germs and maintain good hand hygiene. Ultimately, the choice of hand soap depends on personal preference and individual needs. It is always advisable to choose a soap that is effective in killing germs while also being gentle on the skin. Following proper handwashing techniques, such as lathering for at least 20 seconds and thoroughly rinsing, are essential for overall effectiveness in reducing the spread of germs.
What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?
Sodium hydroxide, also known as lye, is a strong base commonly used in the soap industry. It plays a key role in the saponification process, where fats and oils are converted into soap. Sodium hydroxide is essential for creating solid soap bars and has a broad range of applications in other industries as well.
What is the alcohol content in D2 Sanitizers' hand sanitizers?
D2 Sanitizers’ hand sanitizers contain a high alcohol content, typically between 70% and 80%, to provide effective protection against germs and bacteria. Exact alcohol percentages can be found on the product labels.
Still have questions?

Who do I contact for bulk product orders?

You can reach a D2 Sanitizers representative by sending an email to mike@d2sanitizers.com, giving us a call at (762) 255-8353 or filling out our [**contact**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/contact) form.

We would love to hear your feedback! Please leave a product and customer service review.

What are industrial hand soaps?

An industrial hand soap is typically a combination of a hand cleaner and skin conditioners. It is designed to remove tough substances such as dirt, grease and grime on hands and arm region. Best Sanitizers' industrial soaps perform as a heavy duty hand cleaners while moisturizing the skin.

Is this safe for sensitive skin?

Since Alpet E1 is fragrance-free, it is an optimal antibacterial soap for sensitive skin.

Antibacterial soap vs. plain soap: Which is better?

The effectiveness of a soap depends on its purpose and capability to remove dirt and grime when washing the body and hands. Antibacterial soaps contain an ingredient called Triclosan, which protects from infections, disinfects and keep hands clean. This ingredient makes antibacterial products superior for preventing illness and killing germs on hands. However, according to the FDA, there has not been enough research to conclude that antibacterial soaps are safer than plain soaps.

What is the benzalkonium chloride (BAC) formula?

Benzalkonium chloride (BAC) is an active ingredient in household cleaners, hand sanitizers and many liquid soaps, including disinfectant soaps. As an antimicrobial agent, the BAC formula disrupts the functionality of many pathogens such as bacteria, viruses and fungi. Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.

Is this soap an antibacterial soap?

Yes, HACCP Q E2 soap is classified as antibacterial since the soap is able to reduce the amount of bacteria on the skin. Antibacterial soap is able to wipe away pathogens after a hand wash, which bar soap cannot do.

What does HACCP stand for?

HACCP stands for Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points. It is an approach for measuring the safety of products, procedures and prevention inside food production facilities and health care settings. The goal for HACCP is to protect food from spreading illness, like foodborne illness, and assuring that the food is safe and will not harm consumers.

When a product label displays "HACCP," it means that the product is designed to prevent foodborne illness in food production.

What is industrial hand soap?

Industrial hand soap is a specially formulated soap designed for use in industrial settings or other environments that require heavy-duty cleaning. It is specifically engineered to remove tough stains, grease, heavy dirt, oil and other stubborn contaminants from the hands. Industrial hand soaps are typically more powerful and effective than regular soaps, making them ideal for industries such as food manufacturing, construction, automotive and healthcare. These soaps sometimes contain additional ingredients, like pumice or grit, to provide an extra level of scrubbing power. By using industrial hand soap, workers can ensure their hands are thoroughly clean and free of any potentially harmful substances.

What is the advantage of foam hand soap?

Foam hand soap has several advantages over traditional liquid soap. First, the foaming action creates a rich lather that spreads easily across your hands, ensuring thorough coverage and effective cleansing. Second, foam soap uses less water than liquid soap, making it more eco-friendly and cost-effective in the long run. Additionally, foam soap dispensers are designed to deliver the optimum amount of product for each use, reducing waste and saving you money. Lastly, many foam hand soaps are formulated with moisturizing ingredients to keep your skin soft and hydrated, even with frequent use.

What is citric acid powder, and how is it used in soap?

Citric acid powder is a common soap additive used to adjust the pH of the soap and act as a chelating agent. It helps prevent soap scum and improves the soap’s overall texture and effectiveness, especially in hard water areas.

What hand soap do hospitals use?

Hospitals typically use a hand soap that is specifically formulated to meet the rigorous hygiene standards required in healthcare settings. These soaps are designed to effectively kill a wide range of bacteria, viruses and other pathogens, helping to prevent the spread of infections. They often contain antimicrobial agents, such as benzalkonium chloride or chlorhexidine gluconate, which have been proven to effectively eliminate harmful microorganisms. Hospital hand soaps are usually gentle on the skin and may include moisturizing ingredients to prevent dryness and irritation caused by frequent handwashing.

Which hand soap kills the most germs?

When it comes to killing germs, one of the most effective hand soaps is antibacterial soap. Antibacterial hand soaps contain active ingredients, such as triclosan or benzalkonium chloride, which have been proven to eliminate a wide range of harmful microorganisms. These soaps work by disrupting the cell membranes of bacteria, viruses and other germs, effectively killing them on contact. However, it's important to note that regular handwashing with any soap, even non-antibacterial ones, can still help reduce the spread of germs and maintain good hand hygiene. Ultimately, the choice of hand soap depends on personal preference and individual needs. It is always advisable to choose a soap that is effective in killing germs while also being gentle on the skin. Following proper handwashing techniques, such as lathering for at least 20 seconds and thoroughly rinsing, are essential for overall effectiveness in reducing the spread of germs.

What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?

Sodium hydroxide, also known as lye, is a strong base commonly used in the soap industry. It plays a key role in the saponification process, where fats and oils are converted into soap. Sodium hydroxide is essential for creating solid soap bars and has a broad range of applications in other industries as well.

What is the alcohol content in D2 Sanitizers' hand sanitizers?

D2 Sanitizers’ hand sanitizers contain a high alcohol content, typically between 70% and 80%, to provide effective protection against germs and bacteria. Exact alcohol percentages can be found on the product labels.

### Still have questions?
